study_identification.title: Characterizing the distinct imaging phenotypes, clinical behavior, and genetic vulnerability of brain maturational subtypes in mood disorders

study_characteristics.study_objective: To quantify individual-level gray matter volume (GMV) deviations via normative modeling to identify maturational subtypes in mood disorders and characterize their clinical, transcriptomic, and genetic differences; and to validate imaging-based subtyping in an independent replication cohort.

dataset_name.Answer: Single-site local cohort (First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University, Shenyang)
dataset_name.Reason: Participants (patients and HC) were recruited and scanned at the same hospital/site; no external public dataset used.
dataset_name.Supporting Text: All the patients were recruited … Department of Psychiatry of the First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University … HC participants were recruited from the local community … Structural MRI scanning was conducted … at the First Affiliated Hospital, China Medical University.

hc_n.Reason: Explicitly states number of healthy controls in discovery dataset.
hc_n.Supporting Text: We recruited 114 MDD patients, 60 BD patients and 404 healthy controls (HC).

hc_age.Reason: HC age (mean±SD) is provided in Supplementary Table S1; no range reported.

hc_sex.Reason: Sex counts for HC are reported; percentages computed from N=404.

imaging_modality.Reason: Structural T1-weighted images acquired on 3.0T system.
imaging_modality.Supporting Text: Structural MRI … T1-weighted images were acquired … three-dimensional fast spoiled gradient-echo.

analysis_level.Reason: Voxel-wise GMV was summarized to ROI-wise gray matter density using the 68-region Desikan–Killiany atlas for between-group analyses and subtyping inputs.
analysis_level.Supporting Text: The Desikan–Killiany (DK) parcellation … 68 cortical regions … ROI-wise gray matter density … used for investigating between-group differences.

preprocessing_pipeline.Answer: CAT12; SPM12; VBM; DARTEL normalization; DK atlas parcellation
preprocessing_pipeline.Reason: Preprocessing explicitly describes CAT12 in SPM12 with standard VBM steps, DARTEL normalization, and DK ROI parcellation.
preprocessing_pipeline.Supporting Text: T1-weighted images were preprocessed using … CAT12 implemented in SPM12 … Diffeomorphic Anatomical Registration Exponentiated Lie Algebra … voxel-wise estimates of GMV … Desikan–Killiany parcellation … ROI-wise gray matter density.

quality_checking.Reason: Automated QC using CAT12 IQR metrics with explicit pass/fail thresholds applied.
quality_checking.Supporting Text: The quality of images was assessed by … IQR … An image was classified as to fail QC if … We applied the cut-off (>=80%, >= grad B).

quality_checking_detail.Answer: Automated CAT12 Image Quality Rating (IQR); fail if noise grade ≤ C (70%) and total IQR < B (80%); applied cutoff ≥80% (grade B) to include; overall IQR ~86.4%±0.74% (Dataset1) and 86.3%±0.72% (Dataset2).
quality_checking_detail.Reason: QC details and thresholds are explicitly provided with summary statistics.
quality_checking_detail.Supporting Text: … percentage rating (0-100%) … fail QC if … noise grade ≤ 'C' (70%) and total IQR < 'B'(80%). … applied the cut-off (>=80%, >= grad B) … general IQR ratings … 86.4% ± 0.74% … 86.3% ± 0.72%.

site_effect_handling.Reason: Single-site acquisition on one scanner; no batch/site harmonization method described or required.
site_effect_handling.Supporting Text: Structural MRI scanning was conducted on a Signa HDx 3.0T … at the First Affiliated Hospital, China Medical University.

site_effect_handling_detail.Reason: Single-site study; no site/scanner harmonization approach applicable.
site_effect_handling_detail.Supporting Text: Single scanner/site detailed in acquisition section; no mention of ComBat/HBR or similar.

model_origin.Reason: Normative curves were trained from the study's HC cohort using quantile regression.
model_origin.Supporting Text: … created normative curves with age based on GMV in HC group … Quantile regression was used to obtain a normative range …

model_origin_detail.Reason: No external pre-trained model; normative model trained de novo on local HC.
model_origin_detail.Supporting Text: … quantile normative modeling to create maturation curves … based on HC group.

modeling_method.Answer: Quantile regression normative modeling (age- and sex-dependent GMV percentiles; z5/z50/z95 deviation scores)
modeling_method.Reason: Methods section explicitly states quantile regression and the computation of deviation z-scores at 5th/50th/95th percentiles.
modeling_method.Supporting Text: Quantile regression was used … expressed … z5 … z50 … z95 … as individual deviation z-scores for each brain region.

software_tool.Reason: Software/library for quantile regression not specified (e.g., R quantreg, Python).
software_tool.Supporting Text: No mention of specific software for the normative modeling step.
software_tool.Page/Line: materials/Zheng2024.pdf.md: normative modeling section (no tool named)

response_variable.Answer: ROI-wise gray matter volume/density (Desikan–Killiany 68 cortical regions)
response_variable.Reason: GMV derived via VBM, summarized to DK ROIs and used to compute deviations and subtyping.
response_variable.Supporting Text: Voxel wised gray matter density … Desikan–Killiany … ROI-wise gray matter density … used …

predictor_variables.Reason: Quantile regression modeled regional GMV as a function of age and sex.
predictor_variables.Supporting Text: … normative range of regional GMV variation as a function of age and sex …

predictor_effects.Answer: Age and Sex modeled as predictors in quantile regression; fixed-effects specification not otherwise detailed.
predictor_effects.Reason: Paper specifies predictors but not effect type (fixed/random) in the normative model; single-site so no site effects considered.
predictor_effects.Supporting Text: Quantile regression … as a function of age and sex … (no statement on effect type).

nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Answer: Single-site acquisition avoids inter-site batch effects; quantile modeling captures age-related trends; TIV included as covariate in downstream analyses; no explicit modeling of heteroscedasticity beyond quantiles.
nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Reason: Nuisance structures like site/scanner variance are minimized by single-site design; age and sex handled in model; TIV addressed in analysis.
nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Supporting Text: Single 3.0T scanner at one site … Quantile regression … function of age and sex … TIV … used as a covariate …

nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Answer: Subtyping stability assessed via Adjusted Rand Index (ARI) with 10-fold cross-validation and 1000 permutations within discovery dataset.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Reason: Explicit description of ARI-based internal validation with resampling.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Supporting Text: … chose the clustering solution with the highest averaged ARI following 10-fold cross-validation with 1000 times permutations …

nm_vldtn_same_domain_indep.Reason: No explicit held-out independent subset within the same domain reported for normative model evaluation.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_indep.Supporting Text: Internal validation described for clustering stability only; no held-out test set mentioned for normative fit.

nm_vldtn_diff_domain.Reason: Replication performed in an independent medicated patient cohort from the same site/scanner (different cohort but not multi-site external domain).
nm_vldtn_diff_domain.Supporting Text: We also validated the GMV deviations based subtyping analysis in a replication cohort … 174 drug-free patients constitute the discovery dataset … 268 medicated patients comprise the validated dataset …

clinical_dataset.Answer: Discovery: 174 drug-naïve/drug-free MDD/BD; HC=404. Replication: 268 medicated MDD/BD (same site).
clinical_dataset.Reason: Discovery and replication cohort compositions are clearly stated.
clinical_dataset.Supporting Text: We recruited 114 MDD, 60 BD and 404 HC … We also validated … in a replication cohort … 268 medicated patients …

diseases_studied.Supporting Text: … patients with major depressive disorder and bipolar disorder …

clinical_groups_n.Supporting Text: We recruited 114 MDD patients, 60 BD patients … Table S1 … N=114 (MDD), N=60 (BD)

clinical_groups_age.Reason: Ages for MDD and BD groups provided in Table S1.

clinical_groups_sex.Reason: Sex counts provided; percentages computed from group Ns.

deviation_metric.Answer: Normative deviation z-scores from quantile regression percentiles (z5, z50, z95); classification of supra/infra-normal using |z|>1.96; z50 maps used for clustering.
deviation_metric.Reason: Deviation definitions and thresholds explicitly described.
deviation_metric.Supporting Text: … expressed … z5 … z50 … z95 … as individual deviation z-scores … (z95 > 1.96, z5 < -1.96) … z50 maps … used to perform subtyping …

clinical_application_and_analysis.association_analysis: Between-subtype comparisons of clinical symptoms (HAMD/HAMA/BPRS) and cognition (WCST); construction and comparison of symptom networks via graph theory (density/strength); imaging transcriptomics using AHBA with PLS and pathway/cell-type enrichment; polygenic risk scores (PRS) for AD and MDD computed via PRSice and compared between subtypes.
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_findings_brief: Two subtypes emerged: subtype 1 showed increased frontal GMV deviations with poorer cognitive performance and higher AD genetic risk, while subtype 2 showed globally decreased GMV deviations with more severe depressive symptoms and higher MDD genetic risk; regional deviation patterns replicated in an independent cohort.
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_findings_detailed: Subtyping of 174 drug-free patients yielded subtype 1 (n=112) with supra-normal deviations in frontal/cingulate/paracentral cortex and subtype 2 (n=62) with widespread infra-normal deviations (and occipital supra-normal). Subtype 2 had higher HAMD total (23.82±8.9) than subtype 1 (20.08±7.5; t=2.67, PFDR=0.025). Subtype 1 showed worse WCST performance vs HC (e.g., WCST-PE t=4.00, PFDR=0.001), while subtype 2 did not differ from HC. Symptom network density/strength were higher in subtype 2 (0.51/6.76) vs subtype 1 (0.42/5.24). Gene enrichment associated subtype 1 with AD-related pathways and oligodendrocyte/endothelial cell signatures, and subtype 2 with microglia/inhibitory neuron signatures. PRS analyses indicated higher AD risk in subtype 1 and higher MDD risk in subtype 2. Regional z50 deviation maps correlated across discovery and replication cohorts (r=0.29, p<0.05 in subtype 1; r=0.45, p<1e-4 in subtype 2).
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_limitations: Use of AHBA gene expression from healthy brains may not reflect patient transcription; limited right-hemisphere coverage in AHBA; relatively small genetic sample size; cognitive assessment limited to WCST; lacked specific data on first-episode illness severity.
clinical_application_and_analysis.application_notes: Demonstrates normative modeling-based subtyping integrating imaging, symptoms, transcriptomics, and PRS; clustering stability assessed via ARI with cross-validation; replication in independent medicated cohort from same site.

general_notes.general_notes: Single-site 3.0T GE Signa HDx; CAT12/SPM12 preprocessing with DARTEL; DK-68 ROI summarization; TIV used as covariate in analyses; no site harmonization needed due to single-site design.
